title: West Brom hope to conclude loan deal for QPR midfielder Sandro with Brazilian in the Midlands for medical
title_page: West Brom hope to conclude loan deal for QPR midfielder Sandro with Brazilian in the Midlands for medical  | Daily Mail Online
text:
West Bromwich Albion hope to conclude a loan deal for Queens Park Rangers midfielder Sandro on Friday.
The Brazilian is in the Midlands having his medical, with Tony Pulis keen to push through the temporary move with a view to a permanent summer transfer.
Sandro, signed by QPR from Spurs for £10million in September 2014, has only played 11 times this season, and last featured on December 28. But Pulis is keen for reinforcements with James Morrison sustaining a significant hamstring injury.
QPR midfielder Sandro is in the Midlands having a medical with West Brom hoping to tie up a loan move
The Brazilian has only made 11 appearances for the Hoops this season having signed for £10million in 2014
On Friday morning Pulis said: 'We are interested in Sandro but nothing has been done yet, that's ongoing. Whether we can do a deal or not we will have to wait and see.
'We are working on it, if we can get a deal done, we will get a deal done and if we can't we can't and we will have to move on. It is potentially a loan with a view to a permanent if we can do it.’
Callum McManaman has been ruled out for up to six weeks with an ankle ligament injury.
